intro: Dichazothece, commonly known as the "false sandalwood," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Fabaceae. It consists of a single species, Dichazothece paniculata, which is native to tropical regions of Africa. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, pinnately compound leaves. It produces yellowish flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, and its seeds are enclosed in pods. Dichazothece is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to thrive in arid conditions.
